titleStmt.title: Letter: 1881 The first European fighting and killing at Taranaki: A striking incident in the old (modern) history of New Zealand. Waipawa Mail 22, 26, 29 January; 2, 5, 9, 12, 16, 19, 23, 26 February; 2, 5 March.

p.hi: The first European fighting and killing at Taranaki: A striking incident in the old (modern) history of New Zealand.

hi.note: These letters contain an account of incidents involving the wreck of the “Harriet” and the subsequent actions by HMS “Alligator” (briefly mentioned in the 8 January letter to the Wanganui Herald above); it is very similar to that published as “The first European fighting at Taranaki.” In Sherrin AA. 1890 The Early history of New Zealand, part 1 of Brett’s Historical Series: Early New Zealand. Auckland, pp. 435-458, reproduced in Vol. 3 of this series, What I believe to be genuine and authentic—Ed.
